text: Freshmen Admission (Fewer than 30 Transferable College Credits)
Over the course of your college career, you’ll have the chance to encounter new experiences, challenge old perceptions and be more successful than you expected.
Learn more about tuition and fees.
Learn more about degrees and programs.
Need help deciding what to study?
Be unconventional. Be curious. Be exceptional. Be ground-breaking.

At Georgia Gwinnett College, you’re invited to achieve success however you define it. You’ll have the support of leading professors, global opportunities and a community of peers to help you excel. So whatever you expect from college or from yourself, expect more at GGC.
IT graduate Mark Guevera realized his parents' dream for him when he earned his degree.
Graduates Carla Williams and Micaih Ruiz are shining examples of GGC's presidential exception program.

View application/document requirements for freshmen who have never attended college.
You are a high school junior/senior or graduate of a non-accredited homeschool program or high school. Regionally accredited home school applicants, please refer to
View application/document requirements for freshmen admission, (homeschooled).
Freshmen Admission (Earned Fewer than 30 Transferable College Credit Hours)
You've attended college, Dual Enrollment included, but have fewer than 30 transferable credit hours.
View application/document requirements for freshmen with fewer than 30 college credits.
You've earned more than 30 transferable college credit hours from another regionally accredited institution.
View application/document requirements for transfer admission.
You have previously attended GGC as a degree-seeking student, but have not been enrolled for three semesters or longer.
View application/document requirements for re-admission to GGC.
You are enrolled in a degree program at another regionally accredited institution and expect to return to that institution. Transient students must re-apply for admission each semester.
View application/document requirements for transient admission.
You've earned a bachelor’s degree from a regionally accredited institution and are not seeking another bachelor’s degree.
View application/document requirements for post-baccalaureate admission.
You are a high school or homeschooled student seeking to attend college during your junior or senior year of high school.
View application/document requirements for dual enrollment admission.
You are an international student if you meet one of the following:
Currently live outside the U.S. and will require an F-1 visa to study in the U.S.
Not a U.S. citizen nor permanent resident and currently live in the U.S. on an F-1 visa
Currently live in the U.S. on another non-immigrant visa classification, which permits part-time or full-time study
View application/document requirements for international students.

Freshmen Admission (Fewer than 30 Transferable College Credits)
For more dates please consult GGC's
All application materials must be submitted by the dates below for each semester.

Application and document deadlines may be extended by the vice president of Enrollment Management Services in consultation with others, if conditions warrant. The Admissions office will communicate date changes to prospective students via the GGC website and other communications. Deadlines falling on the weekend will be the next business day.
Free Application for Federal Student Aid
(FAFSA) online as soon as you are admitted. GGC School Code: 041429.
Completed FAFSA application AND verification, and submission of all requested documents
Jan. 2 by 4 p.m., if paying in person, and midnight if paying online.
Find resources to pay your bill and manage your account.
View Nelnet monthly payment plan options.

"Choosing to become involved at GGC has been life changing,” she said. “Hopefully I will inspire others just as my fellow students inspired me."
Bachelor of Science in Information Technology
"At [GGC], we are not just a number or a statistic, but part of a growing family. GGC’s culture was the spark that led to my personal development."
A bachelor degree-granting unit of the University System of Georgia.
GGC has degrees that are in demand.
GGC offers an exclusive community of learners in its on-campus housing.
Check out what residence life has to offer.
GGC is affordable with low-cost tuition and fees. In-State tuition is less than $135 per credit hour.
See more details about tuition and fees.
GGC is a top rated school featuring small class sizes, with the average size being 21 students.
